DOCNAME: CASE OF SUKHANOV AND ILCHENKO v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Aleš Pejchal;André Potocki;Ann Power-Forde;Ganna Yudkivska;Helena Jäderblom;Mark Villiger;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: CARDINAL . Both applicants were born in DATE and live in the city of GPE and in the town of FAC , GPE , respectively .

CARDINAL . Both applicants have the special status of “ a child of war ” ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . From DATE they were entitled to a special supplement to their pensions in the amount of PERCENT of the minimum pension in accordance with section CARDINAL of LAW ( ORG “ PERSON соціальний захист дітей війни ” ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE the first applicant instituted court proceedings against ORG of GPE and ORG of ORG of GPE , asking them to recalculate his pension for DATE , to determine the amount of and to pay him the outstanding indexed debt , and to pay his pension in the recalculated amount in the future . The first applicant also claimed compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage , and legal expenses .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that in DATE section QUANTITY of LAW had been suspended by LAW . In return LAW had empowered the Cabinet of Ministers to set up a mechanism for a pension increase . However , because in DATE no such mechanism had been set up , the first applicant ’s claims relating to DATE had to be rejected .

CARDINAL . The court further found that in DATE section CARDINAL had again been suspended , and in DATE it had been modified by ORG for the relevant DATE . However , this modification was found to be unconstitutional by ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The court consequently held that ORG should recalculate the first applicant ’s pension for the periods DATE and DATE and as of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the second applicant instituted proceedings in FAC against ORG , asking for recalculation of his pension from DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court found in part for the second applicant . It held that the second applicant was entitled to the supplement from the date of the decision of ORG ( DATE ) and not from DATE . The court further held that ORG should recalculate the second applicant ’s pension for the periods DATE and DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Dnipropetrovsk Regional Court of Appeal upheld this decision . The decision of ORG was final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant instituted a second set of proceedings in the ORG claiming payment of the above - mentioned supplement to his pension starting from DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the second applicant and held that ORG should recalculate the applicant ’s pension from DATE . On DATE ORG upheld this decision .
